1.name: Foe-Seeker
1.desc: There are those who wish nothing more than to be at the heart of battle, seeking foes to vanquish.

2.name: Deadly Onslaught
2.desc: Such is the power and ferocity of the champion, that those who stand in his way will falter against the warrior's impact.

3.name: Sacred Spawning of Xhotl
3.desc: Kroq-Gar arises once more, born anew to take revenge upon those who stand against him.

4.name: Swiftness of Itzl

effects.green1: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

4.desc: The speed and agility of the great three-horned ruler is sometimes bestowed upon his subjects.

5.name: Stand Your Ground!
5.desc: On the battlefield, the craven's path is an easy one, but for those champions that choose to stand? Fortune will surely favour them and their troops.

6.name: Greater Arcane Conduit
6.desc: A strong mind is needed to channel the Winds of Magic. Those that have such a gift become arcane conduits - funnelling the magical tempests to their cause.

7.name: Shield of the Old Ones
7.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
7.target: Self, Ground, Ally. Affects allies in range
7.desc: The resilience of the Old Ones is channelled into an energy barrier that protects its users from the full brunt of magical attacks against them.

8.name: The Ruination of Cities
8.desc: The Lord unleashes a force of seismic power like no other, causing the tectonic plates themselves to shift and buckle at his behest.

9.name: Slippery
9.desc: Those who are 'slippery' cannot be cornered or pinned - they simply 'slip' away...

10.name: Blessing of the Ancients
10.desc: The magical power permeating the forests is bestowed upon those who defend it.

11.name: Lamentation of Despair

effects.red2: Strikes any combatants in its path

11.desc: The vines and foliage manifest their rage, bursting forth to entangle and debilitate the foe.

12.name: Sword of Daith
12.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
12.target: Ground, Enemy. Affects enemies in range.
12.desc: This blade, like Durthu himself, is steeped in millennia of bitterness and rage waiting to be unleashed.

13.name: Call of the Woods
13.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
13.desc: The living embodiment of the forest; through them, their warriors feel a greater call to war.

14.name: Scroll of Shielding
14.desc: Upon the Scroll of Shielding is a crude drawing of a warrior's shield displaying an unknown crest of a kingdom long lost.

15.name: Power Stone
15.desc: When a magic-user rubs a power stone, the artefact glows for a split second before dulling forever. However, in that moment, the Winds of Magic blow a tempest!

16.name: The Eye of Kurnous
16.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
16.desc: Setting their eye upon the foe, the general imbues their troops with Kurnous' spirit and the will to see his enemies destroyed.

17.name: Arrow of Kurnous
17.desc: The God of the Hunt blesses this arrow so it can travel great distances with unwavering accuracy and terrifying power.

18.name: Prey of Anath Raema
18.desc: By all means summon the bloodthirsty Goddess of the Hunt to assit you, but always make sure you thank her afterwards...

19.name: Banner of the Eternal Queen
19.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
19.desc: Those who go to battle with the Everqueen's personally hand-woven banner do so proudly, and never waver.

20.name: Potion of Speed
20.desc: The blue liquid in this small bottle blesses the imbiber with a boost of preternatural speed.

21.name: Call of the Woods
21.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
21.desc: The living embodiment of the forest; through them, their warriors feel a greater call to war.

22.name: Banner of the Hunter King
22.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
22.desc: Though tattered and ancient, this banner causes forces to charge - in the name of the Hunt - before the main Elven host.

23.name: Potion of Foolhardiness
23.desc: Those that drink this tincture may well be fools, but they are bold fools at that!

24.name: Warrior Bane
24.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
24.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range.
24.desc: This unsettling weapon spreads a curse on all around, disabusing enemy Warriors of their martial skills.

25.name: Opal Amulet
25.desc: The Opal Amulet can grant its wearer a life-saving second chance, but suffers a hairline fracture in its previously perfect surface as a result.

26.name: The Other Trickster's Shard
26.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
26.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range.
26.desc: A shard of blackest night said to be a prison for the partial essence of the Trickster himself. Any close to it may be undone by its troubling aura.

27.name: Hawk's Talon
27.desc: Nature manifests at Orion's call, raining a flurry of arrows upon the enemy in defence of Athel Loren.

28.name: Hounds of Orion
28.desc: Orion's wolves run with their Lord, defending his person with great savagery and scant regard for their own lives.

29.name: Cloak of Isha
29.desc: This cloak, renewed annually by Ariel herself, is all Orion needs to protect himself.

30.name: Horn of the Wild Hunt
30.desc: When this ancient and revered relic is blown, all Elven forces are driven to the Hunt with a savage determination.

31.name: Apocalyptic Vision
31.desc: In fitful dreams, he sees the end. The world collapsing in on itself, leaving nothing but ashes and aberration.

32.name: The Dark Mail
32.desc: This ancient suit of chainmail can counter the fanciful enchantments and magicks of enemy blades.

33.name: Scourge
33.desc: Scourge is a lethal whip, thirsty for blood and wrapped in the bitter curses of many generations of Bray-Shamans.

34.name: Spirit-Essence of Chaos
34.cannot-target-if: Unit is Lord or Hero, Hit Points greater than 20%, Climbing or manning equipment or on a platform

effects.green1: Spawns a unit of Chaos Spawn

34.desc: To summon the essence of Chaos is to unleash its Ruinous fury upon any and all who witness it.

35.name: Call of Violence
35.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
35.desc: We feel it. We all feel it. The pull to war. The tug of battle. The NEED to kill.

36.name: Stave of Ruinous Corruption
36.cannot-target-if: Climbing or manning equipment or on a platform
36.desc: Imbued with the quiddity of Ruin, Morghur's gnarled staff summons deadly Chaos Spawn to do his bidding on the battlefield.

37.name: Something Wicked This Way Comes
37.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range.
37.desc: The presence of the Dark Omen is an awful thing that saps the foe's will to fight on.

38.name: Unholy Power
38.desc: Malagor has a dread agenda given unto him by the Dark Gods themselves.

39.name: Arcane Conduit
39.desc: A strong mind is needed to channel the Winds of Magic. Those that have such a gift become arcane conduits - funnelling the magical tempests to their cause.

40.name: Icons of Vilification
40.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
40.desc: These cursed items are all manner of blasphemy, from skulls of dead priests to hallowed, torn branches of Loren.

41.name: Blood Lust
41.desc: The blood is the prize. The blood is the prize! THE BLOOD IS THE PRIZE!

42.name: Totem of Rust
42.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
42.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
42.desc: A jagged spike with the corroded remains of armoured warriors impaled; this totem spreads an aura of entropy.

43.name: Horn of the First Beast
43.desc: When this ancient, fossilised horn is sounded a cloud of disarray falls upon the enemy but emboldens the Gors.

44.name: Hagtree Fetish
44.desc: A crude effigy and shamanic heirloom from one of the hag trees that grow deep in the forest.

45.name: Jagged Dagger
45.desc: A potent sacrificial tool that radiates the wrath of a thousand different offerings to the Dark Gods.

46.name: Slaughterer's Call
46.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
46.desc: The Minotaur Lord's blood-lust is infectious - his followers revel in the murder and gore!

47.name: Banner of the Fallen Kings
47.desc: Once a proud standard of one of mankind's petty nations; it is now a wretched trophy blessed with all the Dark Gods' malice and vainglory.

48.name: Axe of Men
48.desc: The Axe of Men is so-called because it hacks through men as easily as other, lesser axes, hew timber.

49.name: Spirit of the Tempest
49.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
49.desc: More than just a Knight, Alberic is a true leader of men whose warriors are emboldened by his fighting spirit in battle.

50.name: Rally!
50.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
50.desc: To rally the troops and bring them back to the fore takes strong leadership skills and an iron will.

51.name: Heroic Killing Blow
51.desc: There are powerful beings who can decapitate a dragon or plunge a sword into the heart of a griffon in one mighty strike.

52.name: Wrath of Manann
52.desc: Those struck by the Sea God's trident are swept away by a crushing tide of furious wrath.

53.name: Sword of Anti-Heroes
53.desc: This sword was said to be smelted in a cursed furnace and then quenched in the bloody body of a dying champion.

54.name: Crown of Command
54.desc: The Crown of Command has been worn in countless battles. Its wearer is given great authority, instilling in his subjects an unbreakable courage.

55.name: Aura of the Lady
55.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
55.target: Around self. Affects allies in range
55.desc: The Lady of the Lake protects her Knights from the devious enchantments of the enemy.

56.name: Channelling Staff
56.desc: A staff of pure silver etched with all eight runes from the magic wheel. Such an item can only enhance a Wizard's ability to channel.

57.name: Sceptre of Stability
57.desc: The sceptre is an anti-magic totem, vanquishing spellcraft that gets too close to its wielder.

58.name: Charmed Shield
58.desc: The front of this shield depicts a warrior being blessed by a nameless lady. Its wielder gains protection from the sigil, especially against foes armed with missiles.

60.name: Dolorous Blade
60.desc: Glowing with an uncanny light, each stroke of this sword effortlessly carves the foe clean through.

61.name: The Lady's Champion
61.desc: Those that claim the honour of the Lady's Champion benefit from her protection even more than Knights who have supped from the Grail.

62.name: Beloved Son of Bretonnia
62.target: Around self. Affects allies in range.
62.desc: Should the Royarch of fair Bretonnia fall, then the anger in its Knights and smallfolk shall be fierce.

63.name: The Lion's Shield
63.desc: King Louen's shield has protected him from the first days of his Knighthood; strengthened by enchantments, it will continue to do so.

64.name: The Sword of Couronne
64.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
64.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
64.desc: This powerful heirloom was forged from the finest Bretonnian silverline. It catches the suns rays and magnifies them, dazzling Louen's enemies as he makes the death stroke.

65.name: Mist of the Lady
65.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
65.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
65.desc: The unearthly vapour moves around the foe, in between and inside - those found wanting are scarred by the Lady's enchanted touch.

66.name: Favour of the Fay
66.desc: I didn't know how empty was my soul... until it was filled.

67.name: Chalice of Potions
67.desc: Reaching to the highest heavens, the Wizard draws a wandering meteorite down upon the battlefield.

68.name: Mighty Oath Stone
68.desc: Belegar carries his enormous Oath Stone everywhere. In dire times, he stands tauntingly atop it to fight to the end.

69.name: Revenge Incarnate
69.desc: Centuries of Dwarf grudges flow through Belegar's veins, who uses them to wreak vengeance upon his enemies.

70.name: Hammer of Angrund
70.desc: Soaked in centuries of Greenskin blood, the Ironhammer has been handed down to every rightful Angrund ruler of the Eight Peaks.

71.name: Banner of Lost Holds
71.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
71.desc: Created by Runelords who hailed from lost holds - to fight beneath this storied banner is to recall the fury of so many wrongs.

72.name: Silver Horn of Vengeance
72.desc: When winded, the Silver Horn sounds a clear note that brings hope to Dwarfs and foreboding doom to the enemy.

73.name: Forgefire
73.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
73.desc: The fires of a Runesmith's forge burn brighter and hotter, its blessing upon an ally's weapons increasing their potency.

74.name: Rune of Hearth & Home
74.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
74.desc: The Rune of Hearth and Home stirs a Dwarf's pride in his noble Hold, Clan and Ancestors.

75.name: Master Rune of Oath & Steel
75.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
75.desc: Armour inscribed with the Rune of Oath and Steel will not bend or buckle.

76.name: Master Rune of Wrath & Ruin
76.desc: As the Runelord hammers upon the Anvil of Doom he shapes the Rune of Wrath and Ruin, causing the earth to crack and vent forth fire and sulphur.

77.name: Master Rune of Negation
77.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
77.desc: The secret of this powerful rune was given to a Runelord by Valaya herself, insulating all under its auspices with protection from magic.

78.name: Master Rune of Grungni
78.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
78.desc: This rune stirs up the Winds of Magic, using their swirling arcane force to protect its bearer and shield nearby Dwarfs from missile fire.

79.name: Master Rune of Stromni Redbeard
79.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
79.desc: Stromni Redbeard made this rune in the days of Bael, Lord of Karak Azul - it was used by Durgin, grandsire of Grimmir, the Ancestor God of Warriors.

80.name: Tormentor Sword
80.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
80.desc: Those that take a wound from the jagged blade of the Tormentor Sword will not only feel pain - their thoughts will be wracked with terrible omens.

81.name: Rune of Oath & Steel
81.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
81.desc: Armour inscribed with the Rune of Oath and Steel will not bend or buckle.

82.name: Rune of Wrath & Ruin
82.desc: As the Runelord hammers upon the Anvil of Doom he shapes the Rune of Wrath and Ruin, causing the earth to crack and vent forth fire and sulphur.

83.name: Rune of Negation
83.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
83.desc: The secret of this powerful rune was given to a Runelord by Valaya herself, insulating all under its auspices with protection from magic.

84.name: Master Rune of Groth One-Eye
84.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
84.desc: Groth One-Eye first struck this rune in the time of Kurgan Ironbeard, when the Greenskins were driven from the Badlands and the Dwarfs prospered.

85.name: The Hammer of Karak Drazh
85.desc: The Hammer of Karak Drazh was struck with such powerful runes it can be swung with preternatural ease.

86.name: Extra Powder
86.desc: There are those who have a knack for pushing artillery and their crews to new heights, allowing such machines to fire further than ever before.

87.name: Ballistics Calibration
87.desc: This Hero has an eye for accuracy, firing rates and enemy sweet spots. War machines will benefit from his presence.

88.name: Entrenchment
88.desc: All the sons of Grungni can dig-in, enabling them to better resist physical attacks from the foe. Any missile attacks they can make are also improved.

89.name: Rune of Slowness
89.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
89.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
89.desc: The Rune of Slowness hardens the air around those seeking to engage with honest Dwarfen axes.

90.name: Fiery Ring of Thori
90.desc: When the rune within the dark ruby of the ring is activated a roiling ball of magic flame is hurled toward a nearby foe.

91.name: High King
91.target: Around self. Affects allies in range
91.desc: The High King is the embodiment of the Karaz Ankor. Should he be wounded or even fall then the Dwarfs will rise in a vengeful rage!

92.name: The Great Book of Grudges
92.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
92.desc: The Dammaz Kron recounts every deed of infamy perpetuated against the Dwarfs, scribed in the blood of Kings and infused with vows of vengeance.

93.name: Deathblow
93.desc: Such is the strength of the Dwarfen arm that a strike from this warrior's axe is sure to be a deathblow!

94.name: Axe of Dargo
94.desc: The Axe of Dargo, a runic weapon of monstrous size, is tempered with dragon's blood and iron-oaths of vengeance.

95.name: Flash Bomb
95.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
95.desc: A bang, a flash - the foes stagger slowly and blindly whilst you take full advantage of their disarray.

96.name: Grombrindal Has No Fear
96.desc: As battle-hardened as he is ancient, the White Dwarf will always stand his ground, no matter the pandemonium unfolding around him.

97.name: Rune Helm of Zhufbar
97.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
97.desc: Long thought lost to time and conflict, Grombrindal's awesome helm inspires already-courageous Dwarfen hearts to even greater acts of bravery.

98.name: Rune Axe of Grombrindal
98.desc: Mentioned in several sagas and legends, could the White Dwarf's mighty weapon be the fabled rune axe wielded by Grimnir at the dawn of history?

99.name: Waaagh!
99.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
99.desc: The Warboss lifts his head and unleashes a mighty 'WAAAGH!' - the boyz echo this terrifying roar as the entire Greenskin horde surges towards the enemy!

100.name: Spite of Da Bad Moon
100.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
100.desc: Da Bad Moon offers protection to its weird and disgusting worshippers, shielding them from harm.

101.name: Tricksy Traps

effects.green3: Spotted only at very close range

101.desc: The Night Goblins are delighted and emboldened by Skarsnik's sly, furtive plans and fiendish machinations.

102.name: Skarsnik's Prodder
102.desc: Skarsnik's pointed staff, pulsating with magical energy, channels the might of Gork (or Mork) to lance out with weird, terrifying power.

103.name: Get Back 'Ere!
103.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
103.desc: Da Boss ain't ready to run an' so expects da boyz to stay put too!

104.name: Potion of Strength
104.desc: The sludgy black liquor in this stern glass flask is a Potion of Strength, allowing the drinker to cause devastating damage.

105.name: Evasion
105.desc: Those with such skills can evade enemy attacks with ease and break from combat, should they feel that it is tactically important to do so.

106.name: Scroll of Leeching
106.desc: This tattered and stained scroll should not be held in one's hand for long as it steals all manner of essence, including magical power.

107.name: Mad Cap Mushrooms
107.desc: Night Goblin Shamans brew a pungent fungus potion that, when drunk, will send the Fanatics into a spinning, whirling cyclone of death!

108.name: Wand of Jet
108.desc: The bearer of this black wand, flecked in glowing jade, can increase the Winds and more quickly power his spells.

109.name: Skull Wand of Kaloth
109.desc: Originally captured from the Necromancer Kaloth by the Gobbo Shaman Kazgi, the Skull Wand talks in a forgotten dread language and any who hear its words are doomed.

110.name: Gitsnik
110.desc: Shaped in the Daemon-forges of Zharr-Nagrond, Grimgor's mighty axe, Gitsnik, has never grown dull despite its constant use.

111.name: Get on Wiv it!
111.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
111.desc: Azhag has no tolerance for infighting, when he issues an order the boyz must 'get on wiv it' or pay with a particularly grisly death.

112.name: Scroll of Power
112.desc: Scrawled upon the Power Scroll are runes to boost the power of a single spell. Use it wisely...

113.name: Warpaint of Wurrzag
113.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
113.desc: The terrifying visage painted upon Wurrzag affects enemies' concentration, allowing him to take full advantage of their confusion!

114.name: Wurrzag's Revenge
114.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
114.desc: Wurrzag inflicts a cloud of confusion upon his enemies, whose words ring hallow and spells fly false.

115.name: 'Effagee' of da Git
115.desc: Recently, Wurrzag has taken to carrying a doll or 'effagee' of his foes and sticking pins in them to 'stop da gitz from gettin' away'.

116.name: Squiggly Beast
116.desc: Once a Shaman, now a beast transformed by Wurrzag and retained as an example of Da Great Green Prophet's might.

117.name: Bonewood Staff
117.desc: Covered in magical glyphs, this staff protects Wurrzag from the many magical machinations ranged against him.

118.name: Gaze of Malice
118.desc: If looks could kill... Oh wait, it turns out that they can...

119.name: Supreme Spellshield
119.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
119.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range

effects.red1: Effect increases proportional to the number of enemy units in range

119.desc: This shield has a reflection so dark that it absorbs hostile magic and reflects it back at the foe.

120.name: Circlet of Iron
120.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
120.target-if: Unit is a Lord or Hero
120.desc: The Circlet of Iron, said to be older than the Elven race, is a potent source of arcane power.

121.name: Destroyer
121.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
121.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
121.desc: Forged by the Witch King, the blade's merest touch can unmake enchantments and wither minds.

122.name: Enchanting Beauty
122.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
122.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
122.desc: Morathi's strange, magical allure enchants opponents, making them question their loyalties and allegiances.

123.name: Heartrender & the Darksword
123.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
123.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
123.desc: The paired weapons of Morathi make the Hag Sorceress extremely deadly in combat.

124.name: Wand of the Kharaidon
124.desc: The sky opens and a bolt of burning, pure Chaos black lightning hurtles towards the foe.

125.name: Loose!
125.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
125.desc: The authorisation to loose arrows without adherence to drill makes for an irregular - and therefore far deadlier - hail of pointed death.

126.name: Volley of Dark Arrows
126.desc: By which an unexpected shower of pointy death rains down upon the unfortunate targets. Ouch!

127.name: The Guiding Eye
127.desc: Wrought in black iron with an oval ruby at its centre, the Guiding Eye grants mystical sight to its wearer.

128.name: Pearl of Infinite Bleakness
128.desc: This peal of blackest jets soaks up dread, fear and self-doubt, leaving its wearer stronger within.

129.name: Strength Through Spite
129.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
129.desc: Hatred is an energy source just like any other, to be harnessed and directed at will.

130.name: Shield of Ghrond
130.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
130.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
130.desc: Shaped into the leering face of an Ice Daemon, this shield is imbued with the north wind, robbing attacks of their force.

131.name: Hydra Blade
131.desc: The Hydra Blade was carved from a single fang of Akholrak, first and greatest of the War Hydras broken by Malekith.

132.name: Assassin's Trophy
132.target-if: Unit is a Lord or Hero
132.desc: It should be no great surprise that those already adept in the art of silent death continue to improve with time and practice.

133.name: Black Lotus
133.desc: This poison contains a powerful narcotic and drives its victims to delusional insanity.

134.name: Dark Venom
134.desc: A victim of Dark Venom knows only a drawn-out and agonising death.

135.name: Web of Shadows
135.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
135.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
135.desc: Woven from the hair of Witch Elves and studded with Harpy fangs; a victim caught in the Web will be ripped apart.

136.name: Black Dragon Egg
136.desc: In Naggaroth, Black Dragon eggs are often consumed so that their devourers might take a portion of Dragon-strength.

137.name: Witchbrew
137.desc: Distilled from the blood of Hag Queens, this evil brew drives imbibers into an ecstasy of destruction.

138.name: Chillblade
138.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
138.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
138.desc: From the scattered shards of Har Kaldra was the Chillblade forged. Its touch can freeze body and the soul within.

139.name: Darkstar Cloak
139.desc: Woven into the fabric of this cloak is the essence of a star stolen from the night sky of Nagarythe.

140.name: Feint & Riposte
140.desc: Quite literally the cut-and-thrust of the Elven way of battle; every stroke is precisely made and finds its mark perfectly.

141.name: Heart of Avelorn
141.desc: Though seemingly fragile, this well-worn heirloom has seen a thousand battles and will see many more.

142.name: Sunfang
142.desc: This ancient sword, forged to slay Daemons in the earliest days of Aenarion's rule, burns with the captured fire of the sun.

143.name: Potion of Charoi
143.desc: Like Teclis before them, the deepest blue of night imbues the drinker with the stamina and strength they need to face down the foe.

144.name: Bound Fiery Convocation
144.desc: The caster utters words of power and a phoenix of pure fire manifests to swoop upon the enemy, bathing them in cleansing flame.

145.name: Scroll of Hoeth
145.desc: Though seemingly fragile, this well-worn heirloom has seen a thousand battles and will see many more.

146.name: Sword of Teclis
146.desc: This sword, created by Teclis, is charged with crackling energy that rends apart those struck by its shining blade.

147.name: Volley of High Arrows
147.desc: By which an unexpected shower of pointy death rains down upon the unfortunate targets. Ouch!

148.name: Talisman of Loec
148.desc: Loec the Trickster's aid comes at a price. His talisman is strange - a bracelet of two interlocking halves.

149.name: Dragonhorn
149.desc: Enchanted by the dying flames of an ancient firedrake, the Dragonhorn hardens resolve.

150.name: The Bane Shield
150.desc: A magnificent shield emblazoned with a coiled serpent, allowing its wielder to benefit from even greater protection.

151.name: Blade of Bel-Korhadris
151.desc: The sword of the beloved Scholar-King is a renowned wyrm-slayer.

152.name: Sacred Incense
152.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
152.desc: This bundle of incense sticks is blessed by the wardens of Asuryan, wreathing the bearers in scented smoke when lit.

153.name: Armour of the Stars
153.cannot-use-if: Climbing, Manning equipment, Engaged in melee

effects.green4: Spotted only at very close range

153.desc: The Armour of the Stars is a wonder, mage-forged plate decorated with gems over a deep-blue lacquer.

154.name: Book of Hoeth
154.desc: This tome has been studied throughout the ages, yet its covers remain as blue and pristine as the day it was bound.

155.name: Starwood Staff
155.desc: This gnarled staff looks out of place among the refined possession of the Elves. However, looks are oft deceiving...

156.name: Loremaster's Cloak
156.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
156.desc: Wrapped in a cloak of grey, the wearer becomes insubstantial and highly-protected against magical attacks.

157.name: Blessed Tome
157.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
157.desc: Tales of ancient valour, glory, and self-sacrifice are bound to inspire those of noble heart to greater deeds.

158.name: Sunburst Standard of Hexoatl
158.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
158.desc: This radiant golden totem generates a golden globe of power that shields those within from harm.

159.name: Hand of Gods
159.desc: Bolts of cleansing energy fly from the spellcaster's hands, searing evil wherever they strike.

160.name: Amulet of Itzl
160.desc: The amulet explodes into a million crystal shards if the wearer is struck, greatly improving their resistance to damage for a short time.

161.name: The Horn of Kygor
161.desc: It is said that the lengendary Kygor, the first owner of the horn, was a warrior who could stare down a Carnosaur!

162.name: Blood Statuette of Spite
162.desc: This statuette is carved in a likeness of Xapati, and is frequently bathed in offerings of blood.

163.name: Aura of Quetzl
163.desc: This string of beaded shells, feathers and bones is a charm that surrounds the warrior in a miasma of colour.

164.name: War Drum of Xahutec
164.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
164.desc: The drum echoes the beating heart of the jungle itself. As the Lizardmen march to war, the thundering booms quicken.

165.name: Plaque of Dominion
165.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
165.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
165.desc: Formed into the image of a grimacing face, this plaque causes the unwary to go mad just by looking upon it.

166.name: Curse-Charm of Tepok
166.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
166.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
166.desc: Crafted in the form of a grotesque face, this charm forces its visage into the minds of enemy Sorcerers.

167.name: Cube of Darkness
167.desc: This small black cube contains millions of tiny pin-pricks of light circling around a sphere of pure darkness.

168.name: Hold the Line!
168.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
168.desc: Those in command of the ranks will issue their orders with a ferocious bark, expecting instant obeisance.

169.name: Crush the Weak
169.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
169.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
169.desc: When caught within radius of Todbringer, those enemies whose morale is already weak must face further penalties to their melee abilities.

170.name: The White Cloak of Ulric
170.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
170.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
170.desc: Made from the pelt of a Middenland wolf and blessed by the High Priest of Ulric, a deadly hoarfrost surrounds the cloak, freezing the wearer's foes.

171.name: The Middenland Runefang
171.desc: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, 'Legbiter' enables its bearer to recover more quickly if wounded.

172.name: Runefang
172.desc: The Runefangs are held by the Elector Counts as symbols of their stately office. They are immensely powerful blades of unsurpassed power that only Ghal Maraz could rival.

173.name: Accusation
173.desc: The Witch Hunter levels his finger across the battlefield and accuses one of the enemy of arch-heresy!

174.name: Skull of Katam
174.desc: The skull of the late daemonologist, Katam, continues to jibber in secrets that could drive the listener insane. It knows how to suck the Winds from the enemy.

175.name: The Reikland Runefang
175.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
175.desc: The Reikland Runefang is the symbol of the Elector Count of this province. It is currently owned by the Prince of Altdorf, Karl Franz.

176.name: Ghal Maraz
176.desc: Ghal Maraz is the lengendary hammer of Sigmar. This rune-encrusted weapon is not only the symbol of the Emperor's mantle, but one of the most potent artefacts in the world.

177.name: Staff of Volans
177.desc: Volans was the first Supreme Patriarch, his staff is a symbol of office to any Wizard that now holds that mantle. It also allows the wielder to bend the Winds to his will.

178.name: Benediction
178.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
178.desc: The Warrior Priest passes the blessings of the Heldenhammer to the brave men around him.

179.name: Divine Power
179.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
179.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
179.desc: Such is the strength of Sigmar's favour that enemies fail to act in the presence of such brilliance.

180.name: Jade Griffon
180.desc: This small idol shimmers with an eerie green light, bestowing unnatural regenerative powers upon the wearer.

181.name: Mace of Helsturm
181.desc: Used by Johann Helsturm, the first Grand Theogonist. When wielded by a warrior whose devotion is beyond reproach the head of the mace glows so brightly it bursts into flame.

182.name: Banner of Eternal Flame
182.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
182.desc: This banner burns with a fire that can never be quenched, imbuing its bearers with flaming weapons and fiery eyes.

183.name: The Hunger
183.desc: As the Vampires rip apart their victims they feast on the blood that spills forth - gaining in strength and lost stamina.

184.name: El Syf
184.target-if: Unit is a Lord or Hero
184.desc: The so-called 'Northern Sword' fears no duel; anyone who dares confront him will surely meet their death!

185.name: Master of the Dead
185.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
185.disabled-if: Leadership is broken, Engaged in melee
185.desc: Necromancers can not only marshal the dead, but leech the power from any souls fleeing their mortal remains.

186.name: Magical Animus
186.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
186.desc: With an arcane cry, all around rally to fight in battle once more.

187.name: Wand of Jet
187.desc: The bearer of this black wand, flecked in glowing jade, can increase the Winds and more quickly power his spells.

188.name: Undeath Resurgent
188.desc: Arise! Do not falter! Do not crumble! Back to life once more!

189.name: Skabscrath
189.desc: The lengendary sword of an Undead mercenary, it is said the blade cannot be sheathed without first taking a life and will emit a terrifying squeal until it does.

190.name: The Screaming Banner
190.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
190.desc: The squalling wails emanating from the folds of this tattered standard recall untold horrors. Foes who hear it beg for the release of their tormented souls.

191.name: Forbidden Rod
191.desc: This marble and golden-laced artefact can summon the Winds of Magic, but at a cost to the user.

192.name: Dark Benediction
192.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
192.desc: Dark Blessings given freely from long-dead souls follow in the Wight Kings wake. And so the dead strive for Unlife...

193.name: Immortal Will
193.desc: Immortal spirits will refuse to leave the bounds of the mortal plane, and so cannot be put to rest with ease.

194.name: Master of the Black Arts
194.desc: The Winds of Magic themselves present little challenge to von Carstein, so matchless is he in his magical prowess.

195.name: Sword of Unholy Power
195.desc: Whenever this blade tastes blood, its wielder seems to exert greater control over the Winds of Magic.

196.name: Lord of Undeath
196.cannot-target-if: Climbing or manning equipment or on a platform
196.desc: The Lichemaster raises the ancient Wight to do his bidding, but Krell serves Nagash first and foremost...

197.name: Chaos Tomb Blade
197.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
197.desc: This evil weapon entraps the souls of those in cleaves, binding their fleshless remains in servitude.

198.name: Cloak of Mists & Shadows
198.desc: Kemmler is surrounded by a dark cloak that swirls and twists with a life of its own.

199.name: The Liber Noctus
199.desc: This decrepit tome bristles with dark secrets and eldritch powers. Reading from it summons dark thoughts and grim deeds.

200.name: Aura of Dark Grandeur
200.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
200.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
200.desc: Vlad motivates his devoted followers with his majestic presence; the Lord of Undeath is without peer.

201.name: Master of Beguilement
201.desc: This Vampire Lord feints and shades, confounding their enemy into missteps and errors.

202.name: Blood Drinker
202.desc: This accursed blade drinks deep of its victim's blood, restoring vigour and strength to the one who brandishes it.

203.name: The Carstein Ring
203.desc: An ancestral ring, set with a gem of deep, sanguine claret, that has granted the von Carsteins everlasting Undeath.

204.name: Red Fury
204.desc: Vampires have long had a savage and unstoppable bloodlust. They will continue to slaughter until their enemies lie dead at their feet, or have been turned to Undeath.

205.name: Blood Chalice of Bathori
205.target-if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

effects.green1: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants

205.desc: The life essence of many wretched, innocent smallfolk ensures that those who drink from this cursed cup thrive with newfound power.

206.name: Verminous Valour

effects.green1: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

206.desc: There is a sense in which the Skaven's natural cowardice can appear to be the very pinnacle of honourable conduct.

207.name: Trophy Heads
207.target-if: Unit is a Lord or Hero
207.desc: Oft-times, killers retain the heads of their victims as prizes or reminders of dark deeds done.

208.name: Warp-Shard Armour
208.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
208.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
208.desc: The Warpstone-infused armour plates of Queek Headtaker are as spiteful as their owner.

209.name: Dwarf Gouger
209.desc: A weapon created to kill the Dwarf-things, it perfectly suits Queek's furious windmill style of attack.

210.name: Aura of Pestilence
210.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
210.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
210.desc: All around are caught in a deadly miasma of virulent disease that rips through their bodies with vile momentum.

211.name: Rod of Corruption
211.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
211.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
211.desc: The flail of Skrolk is a rusted, pitted ball of miasma that spreads poxes as it is swung.

212.name: The Liber Bubonicus
212.desc: The vile cantrips written within the mouldering pages of the Liber Bubonicus are powerful indeed.

213.name: Shield of Distraction
213.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
213.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
213.desc: Grimy and ill-kept, this shield bears tainted hides, grisly trophies, and runes that are painful to look upon.

214.name: World's Edge Armour
214.desc: Many suits of Dwarfen Gromril have fallen into the clutches of the Skaven. Then they are remade to the ratmen's liking.

215.name: Portents of Verminous Doom
215.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
215.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
215.desc: Portents of doom most often take the form of black banners festooned with skulls, clan symbols and hated runes.

216.name: Warpstone Scroll
216.target: Ground, Enemy. Affects enemies in range
216.desc: As the words of this scroll are read aloud, the heavens darken and lightning splits the skies, making flying impossible.

217.name: Concealment Bombs
217.cannot-use-if: Climbing, Manning equipment, Engaged in melee

effects.green4: Spotted only at very close range

217.desc: When a bomb is smashed, a dark smoke curls out, concealing those who wish to hide and choking everyone else.

218.name: Rival Hide Talisman
218.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
218.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
218.desc: Wearing the stitched hides of enemies slain through treachery is believed to attract the favour of the Horned Rat.

219.name: Skavenbrew
219.desc: This concoction is made of Warpstone and the blood of many creatures. Its effects are devastating.

220.name: Doomrocket
220.desc: Built with secrets stolen from the mysterious east, Warlock Engineers seek to improve the propulsion and payload of these devastating weapons.

221.name: Shadow Magnet Trinket
221.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
221.desc: Warpstone-contaminated ore develops the strange property of absorbing light. Thusly, darkness forms around the trinket.

222.name: Warpstone Armour
222.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
222.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
222.desc: Wrought within the great Warpforges beneath Skavenblight, this armour radiates an evil aura.

223.name: Pipes of Piebald
223.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
223.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
223.desc: Piebald's strange helmet has pipes connected which allow a form of mind-control; the foe is mesmerised on approach.

224.name: Scrying Stone
224.desc: An orb made of the polished gallstones from the dreaded Blindwyrm is said to be able to glimpse the future.

225.name: Stand or Die!
225.desc: Tyrants and Lords whose word is law ensure their troops will not run by issuing this dread order.

226.name: The Crown of Domination
226.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
226.desc: An ancient battle-helm dating back to the time of Morkar, it exudes an aura of raw malice to cow the servants of Chaos.

227.name: The Slayer of Kings
227.desc: The Second Everchosen, Vangel, trapped the Greater Daemon U'zuhl inside this regicidal blade.

228.name: Lord of the Storm
228.desc: The ancient Shaggoth summons forth lightning to strike down his prey.

229.name: Starcrusher
229.desc: The gigantic warhammer known as Starcrusher was forged in the raging heart of a volcano. Kholek wields this enormous weapon with staggering brutality and skill despite its size.

230.name: Auric Armour
230.desc: The Auric Armour is a sculpted suit forged from ensorcelled gold. Tendrils of dark energy caress the skin of the wearer, closing his wounds with a tender touch.

231.name: Filth Mace
231.desc: This rusted mace drips with Nurgle's choicest plagues and bears an enchantment that ensnares the souls of those crushed beneath its filth-encrusted mass.

232.name: Pendant of Slaanesh
232.desc: This pendant was crafted from the crystallised soul of the very first man to have been seduced by Slaanesh.

233.name: Blasted Standard
233.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
233.desc: Woven from threads of pure magic, this standard is inscribed with runes that constantly writhe, while surrounded by coruscating fires of change.

234.name: Mark of Khorne
234.desc: Those who bear the Mark of Khorne are consumed with a violent rage and the constant need to shed the blood of their foes.

235.name: Hellfire Sword
235.desc: This blade was made from a single, searing flame that was hammered into material form and quenched in the body of a fire-djinn.

236.name: Another Takes its Place
236.desc: The titanic, deadly Hydras are notoriously difficult to kill; their broken bodies regenerate, rising up again to devour anew.

237.name: Fiery Breath
237.desc: Just give the order and the Hydra's heads will spew forth their fiery breath, each competing for the brightest flame.

238.name: Bloodroar
238.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
238.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
238.desc: The mighty griffon lets out a blood-curdling roar, chilling his enemies.

239.name: Revivification Crystal
239.cannot-use-if: Leadership is broken, On a wall
239.desc: The crystal protects those who worship the Serpent God, healing wounds and brining supplicants back from the point of death.

240.name: Tretch's Raiders
240.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
240.desc: A master of exploiting others' weaknesses, Tretch and his band are never where you expect them and always where they can do most damage.

241.name: Stay Here, I'll Get Help!
241.target: Self, Ground, Ally, Affects allies in range
241.desc: It's not running away. It's knowing when and where to be to secure the best advantage.

242.name: Lucky Skullhelm
242.desc: This charmed helmet, fashioned from the skulls of fallen enemies, wards Tretch against magical attack.

243.name: Cold-Blooded
243.desc: While Lizardmen may be slow to react due to their cold-blooded nature, this also makes them stoic in battle.

244.name: Hawkish Precision
244.active-if: No enemy presence in ability range
244.desc: The truly hawk-eyed always hit their targets. Always.

245.name: Lance
245.desc: Forming a wedge before the charge enables mounted Knights to smash through enemy lines, causing great disarray among their ranks.

246.name: Crumbling
246.disabled-if: Battle outcome decided, Leadership is above zero
246.desc: In the blasted desert of deepest Nehekhara, the dead rarely remain so. Those dragged back to screaming, clanking Unlife are bound forever to the Tomb King whose will they exist only to serve.

247.name: Disintegrating
247.disabled-if: Leadership is above shattered, Battle outcome decided
247.desc: The Dark Magic that holds these subjects together has failed. As the necromantic energy flows out of them, nothing is left but a pile of iron and bones in the sand.

248.name: The Curse
248.target: Around self, Affects enemies in range

effects.green2: Activates automatically when conditions are met

248.desc: Like an insect sting at the point of death, striking out at the killer, sapping their strength as if shot by a thousand arrows.

249.name: Unyielding Will
249.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
249.target: Around self, Affects allies in range
249.desc: Inalienable and unassailable in all things, Settra's strength is such that he never needs to return to his sarcophagus.

250.name: Wrath of Ptra

effects.green1: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

250.desc: The heavenly fire of Ptra's rage, directed at those who dare stand against his servants.

251.name: The Crown of Nehekhara
251.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
251.target: Around self, Affects allies in range
251.desc: In Undeath, Settra's crown transcends its original ceremonial purpose to imbue nearby warriors with the Imperishable's all-pervading, unalterable will.

252.name: The Blessed Blade of Ptra
252.desc: This blade, blessed by Ptra the Sun God, channels the baking heat of the unforgiving Nehekharan desert into each deadly blow it makes.

253.name: My Will Be Done
253.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
253.target: Around self. Affects allies in range
253.desc: Death is no obstacle to those with unalterable, unassailable determination.

254.name: The Liber Mortis
254.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
254.target: Self, Ground, Ally. Affects allies in range
254.desc: One of the fabled nine Books of Nagash, this tome is one of the most potent sources of necromantic magic in existence.

255.name: Staff of Nagash
255.desc: This magical staff was plucked from the clutches of the Vampire Mandregan; it enables its bearer to channel the Winds of Magic to his whim.

256.name: The Tomb Blade of Arkhan
256.desc: Those struck by Arkhan's deadly blade are charred to skeletons and then bound to his will forever.

257.name: Sandstorm
257.desc: A violent vortex that whips up a cloud of razor-sharp desert sand to lacerate and consume the foe.

258.name: The Liche Staff
258.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
258.desc: The inscriptions on this ancient staff name Nehekhara's many gods and goddesses, whose quiescent power is contained within its copper shaft.

259.name: Covenant of Power
259.desc: The magical power surrounding the Casket of Souls allows the Liche Priests to infuse their incantations with a portion of its energy.

260.name: Blessing of Asaph
260.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
260.desc: The Asp Goddess healing touch floods Khalida's body, permeating the husk of her corpse and snapping her back to vital, vengeful Unlife.

261.name: Venom Wave

effects.green1: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

261.desc: Even if you survive the explosion, a surge of noxious fumes follows in its deadly wake.

262.name: Tombstrike
262.desc: He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.

263.name: The Venom Staff
263.desc: This staff channels Asaph's spiteful anger into a deadly beam that spews forth onto the foe.

264.name: Reanimate
264.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
264.desc: It takes an iron will and unnatural - supernatural - strength to rally bound troops routed by magical means.

265.name: Scorpion Armour
265.desc: These ornate armour plates are decorated with the likeness of the Scorpion God; his protective energies pervade the very metal used, offering additional protection to the wearer.

266.name: Amulet of Pha-Stah
266.target: Ground, Enemy. Affects enemies in range
266.desc: This moon-shaped amulet projects a disruptive magical energy onto the enemy's defences.

267.name: Wrath of the Creator
267.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
267.desc: Hatred this strong is infectious, contagious, and inescapable.

268.name: Stone Shaper
268.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
268.desc: The strength at the base of the pillar; a near-immovable force.

269.name: Restore
269.desc: Reaching behind the wall of death to bring back the soul and bind it to you takes skill, but like anything, practice makes perfect!

270.name: Vambraces of the Sun
270.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
270.target: Around self, Affects enemies in range
270.desc: Infused with the sun's dazzling intensity, the power harnessed within gleams brilliantly, blinding the wearer's opponents.

271.name: Elixir of Might
271.desc: One sip of the elixir fills the body of its drinker with the strength of many powerful, elite warriors.

272.name: Guardian
272.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
272.target: Around self, affects allies in range.
272.target-if: Unit is a Lord or Hero
272.desc: In the midst of a bloodbath it's good to know that someone has your back.

273.name: Curse of Djaf
273.target: Ground, Enemy. Affects enemies in range
273.desc: The essence of the Jackal-headed God imbues the bearer's weapons with an insatiable hunger for the souls of the living.

274.name: Cloak of the Dunes

effects.green2: Spotted only at very close range

274.desc: The desert itself shall by your coat... and the foe's undoing.

275.name: Blade of Setep
275.desc: The very late King Setep's ornate, curved sword shimmers with a blue hue that shatters the foe's armour.

276.name: Curse of Khsar
276.target: Ground, Enemy. Affects enemies in range
276.desc: The harsh, howling desert winds cut through everything, be it armour or clothing or raw flesh.

277.name: Neferra's Scrolls of Mighty Incantations
277.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area

effects.green1: Effect increases proportional to the number of friendly units in range

277.desc: These eight magical scrolls, containing the sum total of Neferra's lifetime of learning, can whip up an unstoppable hurricane of power to crush the foe.

278.name: Enkhil's Kanopi
278.desc: The simple clay vessel may not look like much, but the High Priest's Undying essence within can thwart sorcery and strengthen incantations.

279.name: Realm of Souls Tier 1
279.active-if: Realm of Souls Tier 1 is reached
279.desc: From within the Realm of Souls - Nehekhara's revered afterlife - deceased warriors are called forth and bound to mortal remains, to find purpose once again through war.

280.name: Realm of Souls Tier 2
280.active-if: Realm of Souls Tier 2 is reached
280.desc: The spirits of warriors slain can be summoned from the Realm of Souls and bound to corporeal bodies, so that they may fight for the Tomb Kings as they did in life.

281.name: Realm of Souls Tier 3
281.active-if: Realm of Souls Tier 3 is reached
281.desc: The Liche Priests use the very breath of Nehekhara's gods to reach into the Realm of Souls, retrieving the spirits of dead soldiers for binding and eternal service to their Tomb King's will.

282.name: Regeneration
282.desc: These are beings and creatures that can mend bone and knit flesh at an incredible rate. A mighty boon, but one stunted by fire.

283.name: Spirit Conduit
283.desc: As a channel between the mortal world and the Realm of Souls, a Hierotitan amplifies the Liche Priest's incantations.

284.name: The Shadow's Coil
284.desc: The wending and twisting of the Wardancers hardens their spirits and their bodies against would-be attackers.

285.name: Woven Mist
285.desc: The Wardancer threads and loops, contorting to create an ethereal fabric that turns aside arrows and bolts.

286.name: Guardians of the Wildwood
286.desc: The minds of these warriors are turned over entirely to the defence of the Wildwood; nothing else affects them.

287.name: Frenzy
287.desc: Some warriors care not for their own personal safety and so work themselves into a whirlwind of destruction and mindless violence!

288.name: Shield of Thorns
288.target: Self, Ground, Ally. Affects allies in range
288.desc: Prickly gorse bursts from the ground around the caster's allies, protecting them from attack like a spikey living shield.

289.name: The Curse of Anraheir
289.target: Ground, Enemy. Affects enemies in range
289.desc: At the spellcaster's command, nebulous nature spirits assail the foe, clawing with hands not nearly as insubstantial as they first appear.

290.name: Soporific Breath
290.desc: Some Dragons breathe noxious fumes that have a long-lasting effect on their target's coordination - if it survived the attack in the first place.

291.name: Primal Fury
291.desc: Goaded by Chieftains and enraged by intruders on their blood-grounds, Beastmen become consumed by a savage furore!

292.name: Rowdy
292.desc: Centigors are emboldened when fighting, drinking and feasting together, although such 'bravery' is only temporary at best.

293.name: Bloodgreed
293.desc: Minotaurs become more savage and frenzied the greater the scent and sight of blood.

294.name: Soul Eater
294.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
294.desc: Cygors crave the souls of enemy Wizards more than anything else.

295.name: The Blessing of the Lady
295.desc: The Lady's blessing is a wondrous gift freely graced upon all Bretonnian subjects, should they but kneel and utter their devotion.

296.name: Icon of Devotion
296.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
296.desc: Far more than allegiance or loyalty, true dedication to Lady and kingdom further empowers her Knights on the field.

297.name: Murderous Prowess
297.disabled-if: Unit has not exceeded the murderous prowess value, Leadership is broken
297.desc: Slaughter! There is no greater glorification of Khaine, the God of Murder, and no more popular form of worship amongst the Dark Elves. It is through killing that Dark Elves rise above other beings. Once engulfed in enough bloodshed, they will often feel their murderous prowess increase, as if Khaine himself was guiding the blades of his disciples.

298.name: Murderous Mastery
298.disabled-if: Unit has not exceeded the murderous prowess value, Leadership is broken
298.desc: Slaughter! There is no greater glorification of Khaine, the God of Murder, and no more popular form of worship amongst the Dark Elves. It is through killing that Dark Elves rise above other beings. Once engulfed in enough bloodshed, they will often feel their murderous prowess increase, as if Khaine himself was guiding the blades of his disciples.

299.name: Noxious Breath
299.desc: Some Dragons breathe noxious fumes that have a long-lasting effect on their target's coordination - if it survived the attack in the first place.

300.name: The Old Grumblers
300.desc: Age, beard-length, and the courage that binds them; motivation, if any were needed, to fight on to the end.

301.name: Power of the Dragonback
301.desc: Strong and tenacious, the Dawi's hardy, passionate nature can be put to lethally good use on the battlefield.

302.name: Liquid Fortification
302.desc: A touch of Bugman's Courage can keep a Dawi standing and fighting, a touch unsteadily, on their feet.

303.name: Marked by Ulthar
303.desc: Those marked for death by the mighty Ranger or his crew may find their armour and shield of little practical use...

304.name: Gyrocopter Bomb
304.desc: As the Gyrocopter speed over the heads of the enemy, their pilots release wing-mounted bombs onto targets below. A click on this button instantly releases one bomb per Gyrocopter.

305.name: Gyrobomber Bomb
305.desc: The Gyrobomber is fitted with much larger ordance than the Gyrocopter. Should the multiple payloads hit their intended target the results will be quite spectacular!

306.name: Spinning Loons
306.desc: Sent mad by drinking fungus brew, Night Goblin Fanatics are released from their mobs as a twirling cyclone of destruction armed with a large ball and chain!

307.name: Martial Prowess
307.desc: High Elves excel as warriors, having trained in martial disciplines for the equivalent of many men's lifetimes.

308.name: Martial Mastery
308.desc: While all High Elves have excellent martial prowess, those that continue upon the path of the warrior will further excel in armed combat.

309.name: Attuned to Magic
309.desc: Some creatures, such as the Phoenix, are infused with magic and use the arcane Winds to fly upon and immerse themselves in.

310.name: Rebirth

effects.green1: Chance of unit gaining hit points

310.desc: With strange aeons even death may die...

311.name: Wake of Fire
311.desc: As the Flamespyre swoops, wreathes of fire squall off its wings in the bird's wake.

312.name: Blizzard Aura
312.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
312.desc: The Frostheart is surrounded by icy shards and biting winds with every great flap of its mighty wings.

313.name: Sun Dragon's Breath
313.desc: The youngest Dragons have a warm hue to their scales and a fiery temper, with scorching breath to match.

314.name: Moon Dragon's Breath
314.desc: No one wants to be on the receiving end of these Dragons' fiery breath attack, which surpasses that of their younger kin in both might and enlightenment.

315.name: Star Dragon's Breath
315.desc: The eldest, most powerful Dragons can destroy entire units with a molten blast of their white-hot breath.

316.name: Opportunist Murderer
316.desc: Greenskins are never gracious in victory. Whenever they can press an unfair advantage, they will!

317.name: Smoke Bomb
317.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
317.desc: Clogging the senses with acrid, stinging smoke leaves an enemy completely vulnerable.

318.name: The Loons of Eight Peaks
318.desc: The Goblin Fanatics of Karak Eight Peaks eschew the use of balls with their chains, favouring shaved Dwarfs instead!

319.name: Squigs Go Wild
319.desc: If a squig is not told what to bite, it will bite anything. Me, you, itself - anything!

320.name: Maternal Instinct
320.cannot-target-if: Climbing or manning equipment or on a platform

effects.green1: Spawns a unit of Spider Hatchlings

320.desc: Somewhat surprisingly, even the deadlist Arachnarok feels protective of her brood, and can draw them to her at will.

321.name: Primal Instincts
321.desc: When under pressure, the primal instincts of these natural predators take over - they may then go on a rampage against nearby enemy units, attacking the closest one and ignoring any orders given.

322.name: Drop Rocks
322.desc: Crude though it may be, swiftly swooping in low to pepper the foe with rocks remains a most effective tactic.

323.name: Strength in Numbers
323.desc: Skaven are craven by nature but take courage when in packs of their own kind, where they move slower but enjoy the safety of numbers.

324.name: Scurry Away!
324.desc: 'He who runs away lives to fight another day!' - so the foul, craven adage goes.

325.name: Snare-Net
325.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
325.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
325.cannot-target-if: Climbing, Manning equipment, Flying, On a wall
325.desc: Snare-nets are lightweight but strong and covered in hooks. They are used by Gutter Runners to capture live prisoners.

326.name: Too Horrible to Die

effects.green2: Chance of units gaining hit points

326.desc: With its last, shuddering death throes there is a chance that one or more of the foul beast's many hearts will restart.

327.name: The Rats Emerge
327.cannot-target-if: Climbing or manning equipment or on a platform

effects.green1: Spawns a unit of Skavenslave Spears

327.desc: Killing a Hell-Pit Abomination is never a simple matter; when it dies many fresh Skaven spawn to take its place.

328.name: Strength of the Penitent
328.desc: As the final battle between good and evil looms, the flagellants ready to embrace death. The time is near; the end is nigh!

329.name: Aura of Protection
329.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
329.desc: The Light Magic aura that surrounds the Luminark gives protection to those the Acolyte of Hysh deems worthy.

330.name: Locus of Hysh
330.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range

effects.green1: Effect increases proportional to the number of enemy units in range

330.desc: As Hysh gathers and swirls around the Luminark, it creates a becalming eddy that other magical winds struggle to penerate.

331.name: Net of Amyntok
331.desc: The Wizard casts an arcane net, created to hold the Great Deceiver himself. Any caught in its strands will struggle to act.

332.name: The Flag of Blood Keep
332.desc: The Flag of Blood Keep flashes violently; the Blood Knights run their enemies down.

333.name: The Chilling Aura
333.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
333.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
333.desc: As if the enemy were caught in a blizzard or wading through treacle, the ice-cold aura slows any unit when within range to a near-standstill.

334.name: Vigour Mortis
334.target: Around self. Affect allies in range
334.desc: The Corpse Cart hardens shattered spirits and emboldens tattered bodies to ever greater acts of violence.

335.name: Balefire
335.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
335.target: Around self. Affect enemies in range

effects.green1: Effect increases proportional to the number of enemy units in range

335.desc: Balefire contains trace elements of Warpstone, so the burning braziers slowly drive mortal men to madness.

336.name: Unholy Lodestone
336.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
336.desc: The ringing of the arcane bell atop the Corpse Cart inspires Undead minions to continue fighting, even when grievously wounded.

337.name: Black Scythes
337.desc: The Black Coach manifests gleaming scythes, as sharp as the night is dark.

338.name: Unholy Vigour
338.desc: The Cairn Wraith and the skeletal steeds pulling the Black Coach are filled with unholy vigour.

339.name: Black Nimbus
339.desc: A pulsing nimbus of darkness envelops the Black Coach, making it sleeker and more resistant to enemies.

340.name: Blasphemous Tome
340.desc: The unholy, never-to-be spoken words of this ancient grimoire cause the Winds of Magic to blow like a hurricane.

341.name: The Reliquary Binding
341.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
341.target: Around self. Affect allies in range
341.desc: This depraved artefacts, when held aloft, restores energy to those who swear fealty to its vileness.

342.name: The Reliquary Corruption
342.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
342.target: Around self. Affect enemies in range
342.desc: Those who dare to stand against this profane monument will suffer from its corrupting influence, to their demise.

343.name: Death Shriek
343.desc: Unimpeded by armour and flesh, a Terrorgheist's horrible shriek travels through its victims, splintering bones and souls, and erasing all memory of courage.

344.name: Blooood!
344.desc: The Hellcannon breaks its chains and rushes forwards. Increased movement speed.

346.name: Warp Gaze
346.desc: Never make direct eye-contact with a Beastman lest it mark you out for a hideous, flesh-ripping demise.

347.name: Blood Frenzy

effects.green2: Stage Two (30 seconds) - 10% Armour-Piercing Damage, 9% Vigour
effects.green3: Stage Three (30 seconds) - 15% Armour-Piercing Damage, 18% Vigour

347.desc: The Bride of Khaine is a consummate murderer; as she reaps the blood, her desire for further slaughter intensifies.

348.name: Gaze of Khaine
348.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
348.target: Ground, Ally. Affects allies in range
348.desc: Those who fall under the glare of Hellebron share her lust and rage.

349.name: The Cursed Blade
349.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
349.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
349.desc: The Deathsword glistens with murder and the Cursed Blade moves with a life of its own.

350.name: Amulet of Dark Fire
350.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
350.desc: This amulet wreathes its wearer in a mystical flame that burns magic instead of flesh.

351.name: Bloodshield of Khaine
351.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
351.desc: Dark enchantments ensure that those who stand close to a Cauldron of Blood enjoy a degree of protection from the Bloody-handed God.

352.name: Fury of Khaine
352.desc: As the blood in the cauldron boils and bubbles, Khaine drives bloodlust to a fever pitch and stokes hearts with a violent fire.

353.name: Arnzipal's Black Horror
353.desc: Reading the dark scrawl etched upon the scroll will summon Arnzipal's Black Horror.

354.name: The Trial of Blades
354.desc: The laughing warrior-women dance into battle, spinning their blades with ferocious grace.

355.name: Lesser Doombolt
355.desc: The sky opens and a bolt of burning, pure Chaos black lightning hurtles towards the foe.

356.name: Soulblight
356.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
356.target: Ground, Enemy. Affects enemies in range
356.desc: Harnessing the sickly power of Shyish, the Wizard weakens the foe's will to survive the battle.

357.name: Word of Pain
357.desc: As the caster utters a forbidden name, their enemies are wracked with waves of agony.

358.name: Soul Stealer
358.target: Ground, Enemy. Affects enemies in range
358.desc: Tendrils of solidified darkness writhe outwards, draining the lifeforce from foes and renewing the caster's own vigour.

359.name: Frost Breath
359.desc: This ice-cold breath delivers freezing death, slowing down those who are fortunate to survive the exposure.

360.name: Abyssal Howl
360.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
360.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
360.desc: The Kharibdyss lets out a spine-chilling howl, terrifying those who would dare to stand in its path.

361.name: Red Ruin
361.desc: Seeking a mighty death - despite his kingly obligations - Ungrim recklessly carves a path of red ruin through foolish enemies.

362.name: Ironbeard's Ring
362.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
362.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
362.desc: Such a ring is wrought in runes of cooling, allowing its bearer a certain immunity from fire.

363.name: Prospector's Spyglass
363.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
363.desc: Dwarfs excel at crafting lenses, making their spy-glasses the envy of all umgi, except Elves, the gits.

364.name: Boon of Isha
364.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
364.desc: Under Isha's embrace, those of fey heart will be protected; that is the Everqueen's will.

365.name: Shieldstone of Isha
365.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
365.desc: As old as Ulthuan itself, the Shieldstone pulses with warding and protective energies.

366.name: Stave of Avelorn
366.desc: The symbol of Alarielle's rule of Averlorn is an ancient heirloom passed from one Everqueen to the next.

367.name: Star of Avelorn
367.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
367.target: Self, Ground, Ally. Affects allies in range(max:3)
367.desc: A diadem of ithilmar with a radiant gem set within it, said to be a star plucked from the heavens.

368.name: Darken the Skies
368.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
368.desc: Above the battlefield, the air is filled with arrows; a shroud of pure death blotting out the sun.

369.name: Mislead
369.cannot-use-if: Climbing, Manning equipment, On a wall, Engaged in melee

effects.green1: Alith Anar gets Stalk, Snipe, Unspottable
effects.green2: Creates an image of Alith Anar

369.desc: As a follower of the Trickster God, Loec, the Shadow King is a master of deception and distraction.

370.name: The Shadow Crown
370.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
370.desc: Symbol of the true ruler of Nagarythe, the Shadow Crown is a simple silver circlet set with a single diamond.

371.name: Stone of Midnight
371.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
371.desc: This jewel was originally gifted to Morathi by Aenarion, before it was stolen by Anar; it cloaks the wearer in shadow.

372.name: The Moonbow
372.desc: The deadly Moonbow was handed to Alith Anar by the goddess Lileath herself.

373.name: Quicksilver Shot
373.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
373.desc: The warriors of Avelorn are famed for their ability to fire and reload in the blink of an eye.

374.name: Loec's Shroud

effects.green3: Spotted only at very close range

374.desc: Shadows be thy cloak and darkness thy ally.

375.name: Banner of Avelorn
375.desc: Crafted anew when an Everqueen ascends to the throne, the banner is a beacon of life and light.

376.name: Rage

effects.green2: Stage Two (45 seconds) - +8 Leadership, +11% Physcial Resistance
effects.green3: Stage Three (45 seconds) - +8 Leadership, +11% Physcial Resistance, +5 Melee Attack

376.desc: These warriors have something of an anger management problem. Funnily enough, no one has yet found a safe way to broach the issue.

377.name: Seafang
377.desc: There's no outrunning the terrible, flying Longship known as the 'Seafang'; once in its sights, an agonising, merciless death is your only possible destination.

378.name: Fight or Die!
378.desc: There is no other choice. There never was.

379.name: Hunter of Champions
379.target-if: Unit is a Lord or Hero
379.desc: Cursed to wander the length and breadth of the world, his never-ending quest to challenge and best the most gifted warriors.

381.name: The Wintertooth Crown
381.desc: Whether by the crown's own properties, or by the grace of the Dark Gods, all things bestial and savage obey the wearer.

382.name: Sword of Torgald
382.desc: Although King Torgald's blade is a prized trophy, it is also an eternal reminder of the consequences of grand proclaimations afore the Gods.

383.name: Flaming Axe of Cormac
383.desc: 'These are days of great power: the trides of the North, the beasts of the forest and a great prince of Kharnath will baptise this world in blood!'

384.name: Ruinous Flesh
384.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
384.desc: Werekin flesh is scored with the symbols and marks of the Dark Gods, granting additional arcane protection to their ravaged physical forms.

385.name: From the Mist
385.desc: Dark figures move and twist within the magical miasma woven by the Fimir Balefiends as additional protection against the foe.

386.name: Berserk

effects.green2: Stage Two (30 seconds) - +22% Physical Resistance, +13 Melee Attack
effects.green3: Stage Three (30 seconds) - +22% Physical Resistance, +13 Melee Attack, Rampage!

386.desc: When going berserk, savage, barely-controllable warriors become savage, completely-uncontrollable warriors; best keep your distance!

387.name: Favour of the Ruinous Powers
387.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
387.desc: When the Dark Gods bless the faithful assembled from atop their mighty battle-altars, loyalty is assured forevermore.

388.name: Giver of Glory
388.desc: The shrinemaster implores the fickle Chaos Gods for their aid, bestowing their dark blessings upon nearby Champions.

389.name: Enrage
389.desc: You really don't want to make them angry. No, *really*.

390.name: Swarm of Flies
390.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
390.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
390.desc: Flies surround this rotting creature, making combat even harder as the swarm buzzes into mouths, ears and other vulnerable orifices!

391.name: Apocalyptic Charge
391.desc: If you see him coming run as fast as you can... not that it will do you any good whatsoever!

392.name: Chain Lightning
392.desc: Lightning arcs across the battlefield, leaping from foe-to-foe with crackling fury until there are none left within the storm.

393.name: Soul Devourer
393.desc: Sometimes less really is more; the souls of the fallen feed the engines of war.

394.name: Storm of Blades
394.desc: What beauty and violence there is in the dance? A flurry of blades and a certain savagery of intent...

395.name: Loec's Shroud

effects.green3: Spotted only at very close range

395.desc: Shadows be thy cloak and darkness thy ally.

396.name: The Wildfire Aura
396.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
396.target: Around self. Affects allies in range.
396.desc: The forest looks after its own.

397.name: Extra Powder
397.desc: Because you can never have too much.

398.name: Magical Void
398.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
398.desc: Beyond the power to raise and bind his Undead hordes, Harkon is barren; in fact, he emanates a field of anti-magic.

399.name: Power Siphon
399.desc: By which opponents are prevented from marshalling their abilities to counteract Harkon's own lore.

400.name: Hornswaggle
400.desc: Do pay attention or this one'll 'ave the shirt from yer back!

401.name: All Hands Hoay!
401.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
401.desc: Everyone on deck! We 'ave them now!

402.name: Slann Gold
402.desc: It is well known that Lustrian gold is enchanted with all manner of esoteric properties; Harkon thinks it will restore his fractured mind!

403.name: Wraith Storm
403.desc: A bombardment of unearthly projectiles; a storm that's extremely hard to weather.

404.name: Captain Roth's Moondial

effects.green1: Summons a unit of Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob

404.desc: This particular moondial enables its owner to pull off seemingly-impossible feats of navigation and piloting.

405.name: Manann's Luck
405.desc: The Seafather looks after his own.

406.name: Spearfisher's Net
406.desc: Look at 'em all, trapped like stranded sea-turtles they are!

407.name: Kraken's Bane
407.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
407.desc: Having deprived the biggest and the worst of its life, this blade hungers for other monstrous opponents worthy of its bite.

408.name: Song of Enthrallment
408.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
408.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
408.desc: From which tide do you hide? The dark moon's tide is not on our side, so that is the tide that you must bribe.

409.name: Ghosts of the Past

effects.green1: Summons a unit of Damned Knights Errant

409.desc: Pale warriors, death-pale were they all; They cried - 'La Belle Dame sans Merci thee hath in thrall!'

410.name: The Bordeleaux Flabellum
410.desc: This enchanted fan keeps Cylostra cool when the heat is on, improving the recharge of her abilities and reducing their cooldown times.

411.name: Van Horstmann's Speculum
411.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
411.desc: Van Horstmann's small magical mirror has the ability to destroy the enemy if only they will look upon its cracked surface...

412.name: Black Periapt
412.desc: The Black Periapt is a grandiose gem of sullen darkness whose power can only be realised in the hands of a spellcaster.

413.name: Dead Eyes
413.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
413.desc: What dead eyes see can never be unseen, nor spoken of.

414.name: Bomb-Throw
414.cannot-use-if: Climbing, Manning equipment, Engaged in melee
414.desc: Supernatural reserves of strength can be brought to bear with devastating effect.

415.name: Enchanted Ballistics
415.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
415.desc: These particular balls give the shooter a magical advantage over their targets.

416.name: Cackle Fruit
416.cannot-use-if: Climbing, Manning equipment, Engaged in melee
416.desc: These particular eggs bog the foe down in ectoplasmic goo, slowing their charge and leaving them prone.

417.name: Pigeon Plucker Pendant
417.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
417.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
417.desc: The wearer of this bizarre pendant is supernaturally protected against attacks from flying creatures.

418.name: Scarecrow Banner
418.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
418.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
418.desc: The mangled form of a terrifying scarecrow has spent too long under Morrslieb's glow. It was taken from the fields and now is a banner to frighten anything with wings.

419.name: Taunt
419.desc: You're nowt but a bunch of lily-livered landlubbers! Know that your deaths will be short - soon you'll serve under the black flag!

420.name: Speed of Lykos
420.desc: The words upon this scroll, when read aloud, allow an ally to move at such a speed as to be unseen.

421.name: Noxious Disintegration
421.disabled-if: Hit Points greater than 20%, Battle outcome decided
421.desc: Corpses bloated from spending too long at sea are like foul, decomposing balloons waiting to burst.

422.name: Gaseous Demise
422.desc: Some drowned sailors lurch from the sea swollen with noxious gases, ready to explode upon contact with enemy blades. Keep well back!

423.name: Abandon Ship!
423.cannot-target-if: Climbing or manning equipment or on a platform

effects.green1: Summons a unit of Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob

423.desc: Every man for 'imself! Swim for it!!

424.name: Merciless Slaver
424.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
424.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
424.desc: Sometimes death is preferable to surrender.

425.name: Dreaded Duellist
425.desc: There are but a few who've faced 'im and lived to tell the tale - you can count them on the fingers of Bernard's 'ands... and 'e's got no 'ands.

426.name: Helm of the Kraken
426.desc: Bow down before the true Lord of the Sea.

427.name: Dark Protection
427.desc: If you need the strength, then turn to me...

428.name: Pestilential Breath
428.desc: Some Dragons breathe noxious fumes that have a long-lasting effect on their target's coordination - if it survived the attack in the first place.

429.name: Storm of the Night
429.desc: When light is absent, the storm rages all the worse, filling the living with existential dread.

430.name: Earthing Rod
430.desc: When planted in the ground this obsidian rod becalms the arcane winds for the briefest moment, allowing the Wizard to cast one of his powerful enchantments unopposed.

431.name: Honour or Death
431.desc: Unsurprisingly, some beings reconsider their options when faced with certain death.

432.name: Heart Piercing
432.desc: When supernatural strength and speed work together, lesser opponents have little chance to counter.

433.name: Helm of Discord
433.typeDesc: Only acts on targets when in area
433.target: Around self. Affects enemies in range
433.desc: The battered Helm of Discord is a bronze helmet covered in withering symbols that both distract and unsettle any attacker.

434.name: Claws of Mourkain
434.desc: From deep within the Marshes of Madness, the Strigoi shall rise again!

435.name: Ghoul King of Ushoran
435.desc: From his shattered kingdom, Prince Ushoran reaches forth and makes Lahmian dreams a twisted, hateful reality.
